org.opensha.geo

Class GeoTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha.geo.GeoTools

  • public class GeoTools
extends Object
    Constants and utility methods related to geographic calculations.
    Author:
    Peter Powers

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double EARTH_RADIUS_EQUATORIAL
      The equatorial radius of the earth [6378.1370 km] (see Wikipedia) as derived from the WGS-84 ellipsoid.
      static double EARTH_RADIUS_MEAN
      The Authalic mean radius (Ar) of the earth [6371.0072 km] (see Wikipedia).
      static double EARTH_RADIUS_POLAR
      The polar radius of the earth [6356.7523 km] (see Wikipedia) as derived from the WGS-84 ellipsoid.
      static double MAX_DEPTH
      Maximum allowed earthquake depth value (700 km) following the positive-down depth convention of seismology.
      static double MAX_LAT
      Maximum latitude value (90°).
      static double MAX_LON
      Maximum longitude value (180°).
      static double MIN_DEPTH
      Minimum allowed earthquake depth value (-5 km) following the positive-down depth convention of seismology.
      static double MIN_LAT
      Minimum latitude value (-90°).
      static double MIN_LON
      Minimum longitude value (-180°).
      static double MINUTES_PER_DEGREE
      Convenience constant for arcminutes per degree (60).
      static double PI_BY_2
      Convenience constant for PI / 2
      static double SECONDS_PER_DEGREE
      Convenience constant for arcseconds per degree (3600).
      static double TO_DEG
      Conversion multiplier for radians to degrees
      static double TO_RAD
      Conversion multiplier for degrees to radians
      static double TWOPI
      Convenience constant for 2 * PI

    • Method Detail

      • validateLat

        public static double validateLat(double lat)
        Verifies that a latitude value is between MIN_LAT and MAX_LAT (inclusive). Method returns the supplied value and can be used inline.
        Parameters:
        lat - to validate
        Returns:
        the supplied latitude
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if lat is out of range
        See Also:
        DataUtils.validate(Range, String, double)

      • validateLats

        public static double[] validateLats(double... lats)
        Verifies that an array of latitude values are between MIN_LAT and MAX_LAT (inclusive). Method returns the supplied values and can be used inline.
        Parameters:
        lats - to validate
        Returns:
        the supplied latitude values
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any value is out of range
        See Also:
        DataUtils.validate(Range, String, double...)

      • radiusAtLocation

        public static double radiusAtLocation(Location p)
        Returns the radius of the earth at the latitude of the supplied Location (see Wikipedia for source).
        Parameters:
        p - the Location at which to compute the earth's radius
        Returns:
        the earth's radius at the supplied Location

      • degreesLatPerKm

        public static double degreesLatPerKm(Location p)
        Returns the number of degrees of latitude per km at a given Location. This can be used to convert between km-based and degree-based grid spacing. The calculation takes into account the shape of the earth (oblate spheroid) and scales the conversion accordingly.
        Parameters:
        p - the Location at which to conversion value
        Returns:
        the number of decimal degrees latitude per km at a given Location
        See Also:
        radiusAtLocation(Location)

      • degreesLonPerKm

        public static double degreesLonPerKm(Location p)
        Returns the number of degrees of longitude per km at a given Location. This can be used to convert between km-based and degree-based grid spacing. The calculation scales the degrees longitude per km at the equator by the cosine of the supplied latitude. (Note: The values returned are not based on the radius of curvature of the earth at the supplied location.)
        Parameters:
        p - the Location at which to conversion value
        Returns:
        the number of decimal degrees longitude per km at a given Location

      • secondsToDeg

        public static double secondsToDeg(double seconds)
        Converts arcseconds to decimal degrees.
        Parameters:
        seconds - value to convert
        Returns:
        the equivalent number of decimal degrees

        Returns:
        the equivalent number of decimal degrees
